Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.host.local

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import time

from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import CmdError
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.connection_abstract import ConnectionAbstract
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.connection_utils import (ConnectionUtils, CmdResult)



[docs]class LocalConn(ConnectionAbstract):

[docs]    def __init__(self, host):
        self.host = host
        self.hostname = "localhost"



[docs]    def run(
        self,
        cmd,
        get_result_obj=False,
        ignore_status=False,
        timeout=600,
        working_directory=None,
        background=False,
    ):
        get_return_code = get_result_obj
        result = AutovalUtils._run_local(
            cmd,
            get_return_code=get_return_code,
            ignore_status=True,
            timeout=timeout,
            working_directory=working_directory,
            background=background
        )
        out = result.stdout.rstrip() + result.stderr.rstrip()
        out = ConnectionUtils.str_encode(out)
        ConnectionUtils.log_cmdlog(
            self.hostname, cmd, result.return_code, out
        )

        if result.return_code and not ignore_status:
            msg = "Command returned non-zero exit status"
            raise CmdError(cmd, result, msg)
        if get_result_obj:
            return CmdResult(cmd, result.stdout, result.stderr,
                    result.return_code, result.duration)
        return out.strip()


    def _connect(self):
        # Nothing to be done here
        return

        self, target, password, source_location, file_tocopy,
